author: matkt0

author: lightclient
content: I'd prefer branches be managed externally under your own forks. If you need to collaborate on a certain branch, you can add one another as contributors on your fork. I do the same - this keeps the branch name space on the upstream clean and forces us to follow the same process that external contributors

author: alita85
content: how do you keep your fork updated with master?

author: lightclient
content: I rebase changes in, so usually `git fetch upstream && git rebase upstream/master`  and repair any conflicts

author: alita85
content: huh, okay. the biggest issue is that it's so much easier to keep branches up to date, but if that's easy enough then I guess it doesn't matter

author: lightclient
content: you'll have to track the ethereum repo as `upstream` though, so `git remote add upstream git@github.com:ethereum/eth1.0-apis.git` to start tracking

author: lightclient
content: replace ssh address with https if you don't use ssh keys `https://github.com/ethereum/eth1.0-apis.git`
